org.drip.xva.definition

Class CloseOutBilateral

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.drip.xva.definition.CloseOut
      • org.drip.xva.definition.CloseOutBilateral

  • public class CloseOutBilateral
extends CloseOut
    CloseOutBilateral implements the (2002) ISDA Master Agreement Bilateral Close Out Scheme to be applied to the MTM at the Dealer/Client Default. The References are: - Burgard, C., and M. Kjaer (2013): Funding Strategies, Funding Costs, Risk, 24 (12) 82-87. - Burgard, C., and M. Kjaer (2014): PDE Representations of Derivatives with Bilateral Counter-party Risk and Funding Costs, Journal of Credit Risk, 7 (3) 1-19. - Cesari, G., J. Aquilina, N. Charpillon, X. Filipovic, G. Lee, and L. Manda (2009): Modeling, Pricing, and Hedging Counter-party Credit Exposure - A Technical Guide, Springer Finance, New York. - Gregory, J. (2009): Being Two-faced over Counter-party Credit Risk, Risk 20 (2) 86-90. - Piterbarg, V. (2010): Funding Beyond Discounting: Collateral Agreements and Derivatives Pricing, Risk 21 (2) 97-102.
    Author:
    Lakshmi Krishnamurthy
